title: Add a project gallery section to the Maa Sharada Construction website

requirements.text: Add a new "Project Gallery" section to the single-page site to showcase completed construction projects using a responsive photo grid.

quotes: Your update is live—would you like to add a project gallery next? yes

acceptanceCriteria: A new section is rendered on the homepage between Services and Contact (or another clearly intentional placement) and uses a stable section id (e.g., id="gallery") so it can be navigated via scroll.
The gallery displays at least 6 project images in a responsive grid (1 column on small screens, increasing on larger breakpoints).
Clicking/tapping an image opens an in-page preview (modal/dialog or equivalent) with the larger image and a close control; ESC closes the preview.
All images have meaningful alt text and do not break layout while loading (use fixed aspect ratio containers and object-fit).
All gallery image src paths are relative and compatible with IC deployment (consistent with existing "./assets/generated/..." usage).

requirements.text: Update site navigation (header and footer quick links) to include the new Project Gallery section and ensure smooth-scroll navigation works for it on desktop and mobile.

quotes: Your update is live—would you like to add a project gallery next? yes

acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation includes a new item that scrolls smoothly to the gallery section and closes the mobile drawer after selection (matching existing behavior).
Footer “Quick Links” includes a new link/button that scrolls smoothly to the gallery section (matching existing behavior).
After navigation to the gallery, the section heading is not hidden behind the sticky header (existing scroll-margin behavior continues to apply).

requirements.text: Ensure the new Project Gallery section matches the existing site theme (spacing, typography, card styles, and hover states) and looks good on mobile and desktop.

quotes: Your update is live—would you like to add a project gallery next? yes

acceptanceCriteria: Gallery section styling is consistent with the existing construction-themed design system (Tailwind tokens, border/shadow patterns similar to other sections).
The section includes a clear heading and short description consistent with other sections’ structure and spacing.
No regressions to existing sections (Hero, Services, Contact, Footer) and the page remains visually coherent end-to-end.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not add third-party authentication providers; Internet Identity is the only supported auth mechanism (not required for this gallery).
Keep the app deployable to the Internet Computer with relative asset paths (consistent with current "./assets/..." usage).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; no new backend is required for a static gallery.
nonGoals: Do not build an admin panel or CMS for managing gallery items.
Do not implement image uploads from the browser or store images on the backend.
Do not add real-time features (e.g., websockets) or external databases.
Do not change existing contact details, services content, or deployment workflow unless required for the gallery links/section placement.
